verb.description: Carry out or perpetrate (a mistake, crime, or immoral act)
Pledge or bind (a person or an organization) to a certain course or policy.
examples: they were reluctant to commit themselves to an opinion
the treaty commits each party to defend the other
try it out before you commit to a purchase

verb.description: Transfer something to (a state or place)
examples: he composed a letter but didn't commit it to paper
she committed each tiny feature to memory

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin committere join, entrust (in medieval Latin put into custody), from com- with + mittere put or send.
